medical_history.chief_complaint: Profound hypoglycemia on the first day of life.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began on the first day of life with severe hypoglycemia that resolved with intravenous dextrose. Over the first month, the baby increasingly showed a tanned appearance, severe hypertension (up to 160/83 mm Hg), and fatigue with feeding. Hypoglycemia occurred if feeds were delayed.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a homozygous mutation in the glucocorticoid receptor gene (NR3C1), resulting in complete glucocorticoid resistance and growth hormone deficiency.
medical_history.family_history: The mother has the factor V Leiden mutation and a balanced reciprocal translocation involving chromosomes 7 and 10. A previous female child to both parents had died in the neonatal period of presumed necrotizing enterocolitis.
